cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference so far is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwave.status: No heatwave is happening right now.  There have been 6 such events this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9 per year.

heaviest_rainfall.status: Record amounts of rain fell over 7.9 hours today with a total accumulation of 13.04mm.  It fell at 8.6 mm per hour at times and ranked 8th from our records.  27.64mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 15.9 hour precipitation event.  At times precipitation was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: Today, the rain fell at an intense rate peaking at 27.0mm per hour, one of the heaviest downpours recorded and ranked highest from our records.  The precipitation lasted 2.0 hours and dumped 7.99mm in total.

storm.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 23 November 2024, it lasted 23.2 hours, delivered 24.56mm of rain at a maximum rate of 6.4mm per hour.
Active storm detected in the vicinity.  The last storm we experienced was on 02 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: We are in the midst of one of the longest rainy periods recorded.  This rainy period is ranked 5th since records began in August 2024.  The current stretch started on 26 August 2025 and has lasted 9 days.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (202°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1754 miles was the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.42 miles and so far today the wind run is 75.74 miles.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 4.0°C) and outside temperature (up 3.1°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 2.0 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1549 m) and inside temperature (up 2.1°C) when compared to today.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 713m to 1594m and averaged 1110.0m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; the temperature will feel pleasantly warm. Also, you’ll experience intense stickiness in the air and calm and still conditions are expected. Moderate rainfall, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and some sunny spells will occur. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.
